Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CI790296492
Licensee Group Organization: Wolverine Human Services
Licensee Designee: Judith Wollack
Chief Administrator: Keisha Taylor
Agency Name: VASSAR HOUSE
Agency Address: 955 COMMERCE DR
VASSAR, MI 48768-8954
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 09/09/2025
Capacity: 30
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
2/1/2024 3:24 PM Phone Special Investigation Initiation
2/1/2024 4:09 PM Phone Other
2/5/2024 1:30 PM Onsite Inspection Documentation received or sent;
Unannounced Visit; Interview
III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures.
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(e) Dispensing medication.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation In November 2023 youth did not receive their medication due to
the facility running out of medications.
Investigation Interviews:
Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
2/5/2024. Administrator reported there were no youth at the
1

facility in November 2023. The facility did not have youth at the
facility from approximately May 2023 through the beginning of
December 2023. Administrator reported there were no medication
issues as there were no youth at the facility.
Nurse was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/5/2024.
Nurse reported there were no youth in the facility in November
2023. Nurse reported the facility went a few months with no youth
and began accepting youth back into the facility in December
2023.
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 2/1/2024.
Complainant did not have any names of youth who allegedly did
not receive medication in November 2023. Complainant reported
Administrator was made aware of the youth not receiving
medications and told Nurse to “handle the situation”. Complainant
did not have any other concerns.
DCWL Area Manager for Vassar House confirmed on February 6,
2024, that Vassar House did not have youth placed from
sometime in April 2023 until December 4, 2023.
Documents Reviewed:
• MiSACWIS shows the last youth MDHHS youth at Vassar
House left the facility on 4/4/2023 and there were no youth
placed at the facility in November 2023.
• Vassar House in care report shows the facility began taking
youth again on 12/4/2023.
• Wolverine Human Services Medication Control
Administration Policy and site protocols: Designated
personnel will contact Pharmacy to notify them of new
intakes. Information will include name, date of birth, date of
entry, allergies, site location, medication, dosage, and
administration times. Pharmacy will create a new
electronic record for client. Health services personnel will
obtain new prescriptions from physicians to ensure
continuation of any medication.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as the facility did not have any
youth placed in the facility in November 2023.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
2

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
2/5/2024
______________________________________
